verses.text: 素祭的條例「如果有人獻素祭為供物給耶和華，他的供物要用細麵；他要澆上油，加上乳香，

words.note: An offering without blood sacrifice
An offering without blood sacrifice
Refers to the milky-white resin of the frankincense tree.

verses.text: 帶到亞倫子孫作祭司的那裡，祭司就從其中取出一把澆了油的細麵，連同所有的乳香，作供物的象徵，焚燒在祭壇上，這是獻給耶和華馨香的火祭。

words.note: Refers to the milky-white resin of the frankincense tree.

words.definition: to burn, to set fire to

words.note: Often used for offerings pleasing to God.

verses.text: 祭餘剩的，要歸給亞倫和他的子孫；這是獻給耶和華的火祭中至聖之物。

words.note: Short for 祭物 (sacrifice/offering) or referring to the ritual itself.

words.definition: to belong to, to be given to

words.note: A classical particle often found in formal or religious texts.

verses.text: 「如果你獻爐裡烤的物作素祭的供物，就要用細麵調油所做的無酵餅，或是抹上油的無酵薄餅。

words.note: An offering without blood sacrifice
Used to form a nominalized phrase, similar to 'the ... that is done'.

verses.text: 你的供物若是用煎盤上做的物作素祭，就要用調油的無酵細麵。

words.note: An offering without blood sacrifice

verses.text: 你要把它擘成碎塊，澆上油；這是素祭。

words.note: Verb-object marker
Unleavened offering without meat.

verses.text: 你若是用淺鍋中煎的物作素祭的供物，就要用細麵調油做成。

words.note: Indicates location or scope

verses.text: 你要把這些東西做好，作獻給耶和華的素祭，奉給祭司，讓他帶到祭壇。

words.note: Verb-object marker
Common compound meaning 'things' or 'stuff'.
Implies respectful presentation.

verses.text: 祭司要從素祭中舉起象徵的部分，焚燒在祭壇上，作獻給耶和華馨香的火祭。

words.note: Indicates selection from a group.
Forms a locative phrase with 在....
Often used in sacrificial contexts for pleasing offerings.

verses.text: 素祭餘剩的，要歸給亞倫和他的子孫；這是獻給耶和華的火祭中至聖之物。

words.note: Turns 'remaining' into 'the remaining part'.
Indicates inclusion or selection from a category.
Highest degree of holiness.
Classical Chinese equivalent of 'de' (的) for possession/relation.

verses.text: 「你們獻給耶和華的一切素祭，都不可發酵，因為任何酵與蜜，你們都不可焚燒作獻給耶和華的火祭。

words.note: A transliteration of the Hebrew divine name.
A sacrifice of uncooked or cooked grain, distinct from animal sacrifices.
Leaven often symbolized corruption or sin in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 你們可以把它們獻給耶和華作初熟的供物；只是不可燒在祭壇上，作馨香的祭。

words.note: Precedes direct object, indicating it's affected by the verb.
The first agricultural produce of a harvest, offered to God.
Often used in the Bible for sacrifices pleasing to God.

verses.text: 你獻作素祭的一切供物，都要用鹽調和；在你的素祭上，不可缺少你 神立約的鹽；你的一切供物，都要用鹽調和獻上。

words.note: Salt in offerings symbolized purity, preservation, and the covenant.
The leading space is a traditional reverence marker for God.

verses.text: 「如果你把初熟之物作素祭獻給耶和華，就要獻上烘過的新麥穗，就是碾過的新穀粒，作素祭。

words.note: Classical Chinese equivalent of '的'.

verses.text: 你要澆上油，加上乳香，這是素祭。

words.note: Olive oil was commonly used in grain offerings in ancient Israel.
An aromatic resin used for incense and offerings.

verses.text: 祭司要把供物的象徵部分，就是一部分碾過的麥粒和油，連同所有的乳香，一起焚燒，作獻給耶和華的火祭。」

words.note: Introduces the object of the verb, placing it before the verb.
Refers to the milky white resin of the frankincense tree.

words.definition: to act as, to make into

words.note: The Hebrew name for God.
